Articles.Content:
These are not meant to be replicas, just proof-of-concept Star Wars craft in Kerbal Space Program. No cheats or hacks are used; these are legitimately flying aircraft.

Mods used:
B9 Aerospace
Infernal Robotics.

Let me know what you think, and I hope you all enjoy!

Cheers,
gGATORr

Edit: I would love for someone with more aesthetic detailing skill than me (zero) to make these look legit. Here are the craft files.
-B-wing: https://www.dropbox.com/s/8qfb1gcgrqdh8vu/B-wing%20Mk%20II.craft
-Lambda Shuttle: https://www.dropbox.com/s/x1vgwi6ykslrkyw/Lambda%20Shuttle.craft
-Naboo Starfighter: https://www.dropbox.com/s/swx4u7l3cq855gb/Naboo%20Starfighter.craft
-Pod Racer: https://www.dropbox.com/s/qab3fhx4hjsp0lv/Pod%20Racer.craft
-TIE Interceptor: https://www.dropbox.com/s/bkbeyijx6afscbe/TIE%20Interceptor.craft
-Y-wing: https://www.dropbox.com/s/tncdsncytllcm9n/y-wing.craft

Let me know if you're having any trouble accessing them. (this is the first time I've ever shared a craft file)
Enjoy! Edited March 25, 2014 by gGATORr
Awesome! The B-Wing and the Lambda Shuttle must have been realy hard to balance.
You sir are amazing! I think everybody on the forums would download these craft.

All I gotta say is NEED download linkage NOW!!!!!

Excellent work

Also where is the X-Wing?

Edited March 25, 2014 by Azref

Thanks everyone!

Elthy: yes, the B-wing was difficult because the CG and center of lift had to be matched in two planes instead of one. The lambda shuttle wasn't quite as bad. A little bit of tactically placed weight and a healthy reliance on RCS go a long way:wink:

Azref: the links are up now. As for the x-wing, I've seen a lot of people make both that (albeit w/out moving s-foils) and the TIE fighter, so I stayed away from them. However, I might have to make one now to round out my collection...

I've got one for your lineup. In this case, it's also a functional SSTO:

Rune. I'll get around to uploading it one of these days, promise!
Very cool, Rune! The Slave 1 never even crossed my mind, but it definitely seems like a worthy challenge to build! It will most likely be in my next wave of ships...
http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/73424-Pod-Racer-with-actual-wires-%28KAS%29-connecting-the-engines%21-%28GIF-no-cheats%29
I must say, I am in awe. Not only from that amazingly constructed pod racer, but also from your Mr. Roboto creation. Well done, sir!
thank you GATOR! ^^ subscribe then for more , atm im working on 2 REALLY crazy and complex robots
